issues.description: The solution implementation declares the toString method with the wrong return type: it is annotated as @Override but defined as public Object toString() (solution repository). In Java the toString() method in java.lang.Object has signature public String toString(), so returning Object is not a valid override and the code will not compile. The problem statement asks students to implement a custom toString() (which by Java convention and the example in the instructions must return a String) and the template contains a TODO for adding a custom toString method. This mismatch between the solution and the expected toString signature is a structural error that would confuse students and break compilation of the provided solution reference.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the toString method in the solution to have the correct return type: declare it as public String toString() and return a String. For example: @Override public String toString() { return "Lecture{" + ... + "}"; }. This makes the solution consistent with the problem statement and Java's Object.toString signature and ensures the solution compiles.
